title: Bug 38131ajc needs -d option while correctly compiling classes from subpackage
OB: A directory named "subpackage" is created under the existing "subpackage" directory when compiling the class using ajc.
EB: The behavior should be the same as javac, where the compiled class is placed in the subpackage directory without creating another directory with the same name.
SR:
1. Create a class in a subpackage.
2. Compile the class using the command ajc -d subpackage\Test.java.
